title: Bike Derbyshire
name: Bike Derbyshire
description:
A Map by Vivelesalpes

Cycling in the Derbyshire Peak District including bike shops, cafe's and knarly climbs.

properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes

properties.name: Bakewell Station
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesA good place to get on the Monsal Trail. A former railway track that was reclaimed well before Sustrans exsisted.

properties.name: Beeley Moor Climb
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesAn \'alpine like\' climb onto Beeley Moor. Not to steep, but a good mix of views across towards Chatsworth and through woodland. On a good day you can watch the birds of prey in flight while you are climbing.

properties.name: Cauldwells Milll Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes A cycle friendly cafe next to an old flour mill. (Don\'t believe the hype - it is not used to make the flour they have for sale there). Food at the cafe is on the pricey side but nice (and healthy except for the cakes). The cafe prides itself in its ploughmans lunch.

properties.name: Elton Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes A great little hidden gem, known only to those in the know. Tin signs adourn the walls. Great, good value fry ups and cakes. Very popular with local cyclists.

properties.name: Fairholmes
properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes Fairholmes Visitor Centre - Bike hire, cafe and trailhead. A great place to stop to explore the dams and surrounding moors. However it is painfully busy at weekends and bank holidays.

properties.name: Holme Moss
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesHolme Moss - Often climbed on the Leeds Classic, Tour of Britain and Milk Race - nuff said.

properties.name: Old Smithy - Monyash
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesOld Smithy Cafe- Monyash. An excellent cake and breakfast stop.

properties.name: Oldy Smithy Cafe - Beeley
properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes A lovely little courtyard cafe, just up from the Devonshire Arms pub. An ideal stop before the climb onto Beeley Moor. Does a nice line in hot sandwiches.

properties.name: Peveril Stores - Castleton
properties.description: Posted by Vivelesalpes Peveril Stores - great for flapjack and mega hot pork sandwiches before you tackle Winnats Pass.

properties.name: Pillhough Hill
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesA knee popping 25% (1 in 4 in old money) climb. Sorts the mountain goats out from the sheep.

properties.name: Rowsely Bar Climb
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesAn unforgiving 20% climb with a nasty hairpin half way. Used to be a favourite on the Tour of Britain and is still used for an annual hill climb event.

properties.name: Sheldon Hill
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesAnother epic climb, worth it for a drinks stop at the Cock and Pullet at Sheldon.

properties.name: Two Dales Climb
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesAn epic climb up out of the Derwent Valley.

properties.name: Winnats Pass
properties.description: Posted by VivelesalpesWinnats Pass - One of the Peak\'s legendary climbs - one in five 20% in places and a test for any cyclist.
